01/09/2021.headline: High-End Heist: Josh sells Pauline the dummy, JobKeeper heat rises
01/09/2021.description: Treasurer Josh Frydenberg and his big business patrons are in crisis mode amid rising demands to end the JobKeeper cover-up and disclose the transfer of billions to profitable companies. Michael West on the unfolding political drama.
01/09/2021.author: Michael West

02/09/2021.headline: Wollemi Mine? Experts label Barilaro’s plan for new coal “corrupt”, unviable
02/09/2021.description: The NSW government is pushing through new coal exploration areas in the state’s mid-west, which have been labelled unviable and “corrupt” by independent experts even as the G7 call a halt on all new coal mining reports Callum Foote
02/09/2021.author: Callum Foote

04/09/2021.headline: Human rights violations now enshrined in legislation – in Australia
04/09/2021.description: Last week, the Morrison government, supported by the ALP, passed a law that allows for security agencies, on the most flimsy of pretexts, to access and manipulate the electronic data of any citizen. It continues the slide into authoritarianism that started with the Tampa affair 20 years ago.
04/09/2021.author: Greg Barns

04/09/2021.headline: The Nouveau Poor – gender pay gap, super inequality stretched in pandemic
04/09/2021.description: Sixty one. That’s the additional number of days women currently have to work in a financial year to earn as much as their male counterparts. And when it comes to superannuation, the gender gap gets worse.
04/09/2021.author: Harry Chemay

06/09/2021.headline: Political Dynamite: JobKeeper for billionaires a campaign wrecker for Morrison, Frydenberg
06/09/2021.description: Big business doesn't vote, small business does. That's the dilemma for Scott Morrison and Josh Frydenberg as they strive to keep JobKeeper secret heading into the election. Michael West reports
06/09/2021.author: Michael West

07/09/2021.headline: Manal Al-Sharif: Australia’s new surveillance laws remind me of home
07/09/2021.description: "I left Saudi Arabia, one of the world’s most oppressive regimes. But the Australian Government’s recent draconian rules remind me so much of home." Cyber security expert and human rights luminary Manal Al-Sharif reports on the dangers of the new surveillance laws.
07/09/2021.author: Manal al-Sharif

07/09/2021.headline: Will jobkeeper rorts bring down the government?
07/09/2021.author: Michael West

08/09/2021.headline: “Everybody did it”: wealthy doctors lobbies ride JobKeeper gravy train
08/09/2021.description: JobKeeper for dentists? Fair enough. But more public subsidies for doctors who enjoyed rising surpluses or hardly suffered a downturn? Callum Foote reports on Australia’s Medical Colleges
08/09/2021.author: Callum Foote

10/09/2021.headline: The Other 9/11: secrecy fight over Australian spies helping CIA overthrow Chile’s President
10/09/2021.description: On the eve of it's 48th anniversary, documents just declassified by the Australian National Archives show the extent to which the Australian Secret Intelligence Service (ASIS) worked closely with the CIA in the lead-up to the Coup-d'état in Chile in September 1973. Story by Peter Kornbluh and Clinton Fernandes
10/09/2021.author: Kim Wingerei

13/09/2021.headline: Liveable Income Guarantee: a rich country can do better
13/09/2021.description: The shift of wealth to the wealthier is driving interest in Universal Basic Income and Job Guarantee proposals as millions of Australians are being left behind by Australia's mean welfare system. Can Labor do better? Brian Toohey reports.
13/09/2021.author: Brian Toohey

13/09/2021.headline: Gucci Handbag: Josh Frydenberg’s JobKeeper gifts to Gucci and Prada
13/09/2021.description: Gucci and Prada owe Josh Frydenberg a debt of gratitude. Louis Vuitton is not alone. The Italians got JobKeeper too. Michael West reports as evidence emerges the Treasurer opted to ignore advice regarding a claw-back mechanism to get the money back from profitable companies.
13/09/2021.author: Michael West

14/09/2021.headline: The Doherty Trade-Off: experts plead for a sensible “Freedom Day”
14/09/2021.description: Experts warn against open slather on "Freedom Day", pointing to the high mortality rate in the UK, as Prime Minister Scott Morrison and NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian prepare to pull back public health measures and end lockdowns. Callum Foote talks with public health experts on the Doherty Report assumptions and the cost of opening up.
14/09/2021.author: Callum Foote

15/09/2021.headline: High Court ruling on Facebook comments a high risk for publishers; high time for reform
15/09/2021.description: In its recent ruling the High Court decreed that commercial publishers have responsibility for comments made on their Facebook pages. In the absence of a 21st century legal framework covering this newfangled thing called the Internet, the Court's reasoning for the ruling refers in part to case-law dating back to the 19th century.
15/09/2021.author: Kim Wingerei

15/09/2021.headline: Privacy is a one way street with this Government
15/09/2021.author: Michael West

17/09/2021.headline: That Fella Down Under! Scott Morrison’s AUKUS deal designed to win election, not make Australia safe
17/09/2021.description: Strap in for a media blitz on the threat from China. Prime Minister #ThatFellaDownUnder Scott Morrison and his merry band are about to take a war to the election. Michael West reports.
17/09/2021.author: Michael West

19/09/2021.headline: Greedy Pharmacy Guild: another coven of lobbyists collects JobKeeper
19/09/2021.description: The powerful Pharmacy Guild of Australia, despite its members' record profits, and admitting Covid-19 did not harm their business one bit, has pocketed JobKeeper.
19/09/2021.author: Callum Foote

21/09/2021.headline: J’Adore Josh: not just Gucci and Louis Vuitton, Cartier and Burberry got JobKeeper too
21/09/2021.description: The high fashion house which counts Cartier and Piaget among its brands, took JobKeeper, enjoyed a sterling rise in profits and gave local executives a pay rise while their Luxembourg parent, Richemont, helped itself to dividends.
21/09/2021.author: Michael West

21/09/2021.headline: Upsetting the neighbours: the high cost of Australia’s nuclear submarine “deal”
21/09/2021.description: Buying ludicrously expensive nuclear submarines upsets our neighbours, inflates the defence budget, unbalances our military forces and does nothing to address the bigger security threat of global warming and species extinction writes Brian Toohey.
21/09/2021.author: Brian Toohey

21/09/2021.headline: Uppercut: KPMG cheating scandal mirrors Big Four rot, business leadership
21/09/2021.description: Revelations of rampant cheating at KPMG echo the broader decay in culture at the top of business in Australia; at the Big Four firms which advise both our largest corporations and government, indeed the firms to which government itself is being outsourced. Michael West speaks with Jeffrey Knapp.
21/09/2021.author: Michael West

22/09/2021.headline: MWM PODCAST – Craig Reucassel & Christiaan Van Vuuren: ‘BIG DEAL’
22/09/2021.description: To see the film go to https://www.makeitabigdeal.org Audio version of the podcast will be available on Spotify and Apple Podcasts...
22/09/2021.author: Michael West

22/09/2021.headline: Has PM put Australia on the hook to finance struggling UK, US submarine projects?
22/09/2021.description: "Almost comical". Experts lambast Scott Morrison's "crazy" AUKUS deal to buy nuclear submarine tech from parlous UK and US programs. Marcus Reubenstein looks at the state of the submarine sector.
22/09/2021.author: Marcus Reubenstein

25/09/2021.headline: The Big Ten Donors: property developers ratchet up their spending on politicians
25/09/2021.description: Research from the Centre for Public Integrity has shown that over the past 20 years, the property and construction sectors have disclosed a total of over $54 million in donations to political parties.
25/09/2021.author: Callum Foote

25/09/2021.headline: “Voices Of” ignites 30 independent movements across Australia
25/09/2021.description: The "Voices Of" movement is gathering steam as more than 30 independent groups seek to field candidates at the next Federal election. Kim Wingerei reports on the new force for political disruption.
25/09/2021.author: Kim Wingerei

26/09/2021.headline: What will the donors think? Liberal/Labor refuse to act without nod from Big Gas
26/09/2021.description: Labor claims it’s a safety issue, Liberals say it’s a drafting issue. The bigger issue is how both major political parties have capitulated to the oil and gas industry again, this time voting to keep offshore petroleum production data secret
26/09/2021.author: Callum Foote

27/09/2021.headline: Ken Henry: The interests of the most disadvantaged are not being served by our tax system
27/09/2021.description: Those who care about distributive justice cannot ignore the extraordinary intergenerational inequity inherent in our present tax system. I am...
27/09/2021.author: Pearls and Irritations

27/09/2021.headline: In competition between China and the US, Australian consumers choose China
27/09/2021.description: Australia’s relationship with China involves many dimensions and Australia/China relations look a lot different from different perspectives.  Clearly the relationship...
27/09/2021.author: Pearls and Irritations

30/09/2021.headline: $66 Billion Reasons: did Scott Morrison get the French submarines right?
30/09/2021.description: When Tony Abbott famously reintroduced knights and dames, few could have fathomed how far this government - with its retro policy bent and its tugging of the imperial forelock - could have turned back time. We now know. Michael West investigates AUKUS and whether Scott Morrison made the right call on French submarines.
30/09/2021.author: Michael West

01/10/2021.headline: Whither the WestConnex cash? Berejiklian buries tracks on Transurban’s $11bn toll road windfall
01/10/2021.description: Just how good is the WestConnex mega-deal which the toll road monopolist Transurban has struck with NSW? Where is the new $11b going and what is this mysterious new "WestInvest"? Wendy Bacon investigates the deception around Australia's biggest and most secretive infrastructure project.
01/10/2021.author: Wendy Bacon

01/10/2021.headline: Gladys is gone but her secrets remain
01/10/2021.description: Whither the WestConnex cash? Berejiklian buries tracks on Transurban’s $11bn toll road windfall
01/10/2021.author: Michael West

02/10/2021.headline: Freedom from Information: thank you Gladys Berejiklian and NSW Health
02/10/2021.description: Dear Premier Gladys Berejiklian and NSW Health, thank you for finally responding to our Freedom of Information request. We ask that, in future, you simply send us an old roll of toilet paper.
02/10/2021.author: Callum Foote

03/10/2021.headline: Crossword clues and bullying – the influence of Australia’s pro-Israel lobby unveiled
03/10/2021.description: The intimidating influence of Australia's pro-Israel lobby does not only limit what mainstream media outlets dare publish, it forces self-censorship on editors and journalists alike, writes John Lyons in his latest book - Dateline Jerusalem: Journalism's toughest assignment
03/10/2021.author: Kim Wingerei

04/10/2021.headline: Smiles for Frydenberg and Birmingham, but not for those on JobSeeker
04/10/2021.description: The punishment for Australia’s lowest income workers continues with the announcement that Covid disaster payments will end once the states hit the vaccination goals laid out in the Doherty Institute’s modelling.
04/10/2021.author: Dechlan Brennan

04/10/2021.headline: Beyond the Spin: workers’ share of wealth slumps to record low
04/10/2021.description: Workers now have the lowest share ever of the nation’s earnings. Under-employment is even worse now than it was late last year. Alan Austin looks behind the spin to report the true state of unemployment and economic management in Australia
04/10/2021.author: Alan Austin

04/10/2021.headline: Playing the victim while the mainstream media runs protection racket
04/10/2021.author: Michael West

06/10/2021.headline: Grave Concerns: Catholic bid for cemeteries finds champion in new premier Perrottet
06/10/2021.description: The ascension of Dominic Perrottet to Premier of NSW comes at a critical hour in the campaign by the Catholic Church to control NSW cemeteries for the next 200 years.
06/10/2021.author: Callum Foote

06/10/2021.headline: Planned obsolescence – how Big Tech manipulates consumers to spend again and again
06/10/2021.description: "Your smartphone has a built-in frailty that will force it to fail in approximately 2-3 years." Manal al-Sharif reports on how Big Tech designs products to fail
06/10/2021.author: Manal al-Sharif

08/10/2021.headline: Pandora Papers: is the world’s biggest leak the world’s biggest cover-up?
08/10/2021.description: Where are the US billionaires, the Wall Streeters, the Big Four tax firms Deloitte, EY, KPMG, PwC? Michael West explores the mystery of the Pandora Papers in this first of a two-part series.
08/10/2021.author: Michael West

08/10/2021.headline: Pandora Papers reveal world’s Tax Avoidance B-Team. Where’s the A-Team?
08/10/2021.author: Michael West

10/10/2021.headline: Profits over People: in-home care a cash bonanza for greedy aged providers
10/10/2021.description: A $53,000 home-care package gets just nine hours of support yet the government has slung suppliers an extra $6.5bn. Dr Sarah Russell reports on aged care profiteers and finds self-management is the answer
10/10/2021.author: Dr Sarah Russell

11/10/2021.headline: Billionaire disrupters: Forrest, Ambani’s new energy onslaught leaves carbon-corrupt politicians in the dust
11/10/2021.description: Andrew Forrest and Mukesh Ambani, the richest men in India and Australia respectively, have just gone public with renewable energy deals on a scale previously unthinkable.
11/10/2021.author: Tim Buckley

12/10/2021.headline: Reds Under Bed: Barnaby and Keith’s plot for Australia to subsidise China
12/10/2021.description: The Coalition’s election war-chest will be brimming with fossil fuel donations thanks to demands by Barnaby Joyce and Keith Pitt to transfer $250bn from Australia to Chinese and other coal and gas companies. Michael West reports on the National Party's latest brainstorm
12/10/2021.author: Michael West

14/10/2021.headline: BratKeeper: profitable private schools purloin JobKeeper, pandemic payments too
14/10/2021.description: Blessed are the rich, for theirs is the tax from the poor! Elite private schools gorged themselves on JobKeeper despite their profits, on top of Pandemic stimulus payments, and as well as trousering a bigger slice of the federal funding pie
14/10/2021.author: Trevor Cobbold

15/10/2021.headline: Business whispers: how Treasurer Josh Frydenberg squandered $40bn on JobKeeper
15/10/2021.description: It turns out the very business lobbyists who stood to benefit most from JobKeeper were regularly advising the Government on JobKeeper. How $40bn was squandered and the role of corporate spinners Business Council of Australia and AI Group.
15/10/2021.author: Callum Foote

17/10/2021.headline: Britain’s Guantanamo: is Julian Assange a terrorist?
17/10/2021.description: As Julian Assange prepares to face a British court for possibly the last time, Gary Lord explores the bizarre twists in the US effort to extradite the Wikileaks founder and the silence of global media.
17/10/2021.author: Gary Lord

18/10/2021.headline: Gladys and the Wagga Wagga Gun Club: What’s the Scam?
18/10/2021.description: Birds away! Gladys Berejiklian’s former boyfriend Daryl Maguire sure did the Wagga Wagga Gun Club a tidy favour when he jagged it a big government grant. What’s the scam?
18/10/2021.author: Michael West

19/10/2021.headline: “Clearly Unacceptable”: Environment Minister Sussan Ley bans renewable project, blesses three new coal mines
19/10/2021.description: In the tradition of Coalition environment ministers, Sussan Ley has knocked back a large renewable energy project while waving through three new coal mines. Callum Foote reports on a government ministry which has found more renewable projects “clearly unacceptable” than coal mines.
19/10/2021.author: Callum Foote

20/10/2021.headline: Slick dealings: Australia on wrong end of Trump era oil play
20/10/2021.description: As Donald Trump would say, nobody does an announcement like Scott Morrison, nobody. Is there any substance to the US oil storage deal which was so praised by the PM and his energy minister Angus Taylor?
20/10/2021.author: Jommy Tee

20/10/2021.headline: Sussan thinks Renewable Energy is “Clearly Unacceptable”
20/10/2021.description: The Story: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/clearly-unacceptable-environment-minister-sussan-ley-bans-renewable-project-blesses-three-new-coal-mines/ Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
20/10/2021.author: Michael West

21/10/2021.headline: Perrottet invests in Putin not Parramatta
21/10/2021.description: Dominic Perrottet’s controversial hedge fund is lending to Russia, China, Saudi Arabia and Cayman Islands. What is the NSW Premier doing funding dictators with NSW taxpayers’ money? Michael West reports on the New Generations Fund.
21/10/2021.author: Michael West

21/10/2021.headline: The “Catholic Cabinet”: Perrottet’s $5bn cemeteries bid dwarfs Gladys’ gun club frolic
21/10/2021.description: Dominic Perrottet's five-man "Catholic Cabinet" rushed through a deal to deliver control of Sydney's cemeteries, ergo $5bn in capital, to the Catholic Church, in defiance of independent expert advice. Callum Foote reports
21/10/2021.author: Callum Foote

22/10/2021.headline: Dutton wants you to pay for MP’s defamation suits!
22/10/2021.description: Story: https://www.news.com.au/national/politics/peter-dutton-suggests-publicfunded-legal-fund-for-mps-to-sue-for-defamation/news-story/69ed36299b449a58b0f1abeba886612e Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
22/10/2021.author: Michael West

24/10/2021.headline: Bad apples or bad orchard? KPMG Australia fails ethics test
24/10/2021.description: It’s a good thing engineers didn’t have the professional standards of some of today’s accountants when the Sydney Harbour Bridge went up, or we might be driving straight into the water.
24/10/2021.author: Michael West

26/10/2021.headline: Billionaire Tuckshop: plutocrats don’t just steal the show. They steal our trust
26/10/2021.description: The Greens have written to new Senate President Slade to stop Australia's Parliament House being used to gouge money from billionaires and corporations. Michael West reports on Treasurer Josh Frydenberg's gala fundraiser in the Great Hall.
26/10/2021.author: Michael West

26/10/2021.headline: LNP Donors are just giving freely…. wink.
26/10/2021.description: The Story: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/billionaire-tuckshop-plutocrats-dont-just-steal-the-show-they-steal-our-trust/ Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
26/10/2021.author: Michael West

28/10/2021.headline: Documents reveal Dominic Perrottet, Paul Toole lobbied for Catholic control of $5bn cemeteries
28/10/2021.description: Documents obtained by Michael West Media reveal NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet and his deputy Paul Toole actively supported attempts to hand over hundreds of millions of dollars in Sydney’s cemetery assets and funds to a company controlled by the Catholic Church between 2017 and 2020.
28/10/2021.author: Callum Foote

28/10/2021.headline: The Printer and the Shredder: Reserve Bank has neat trick to tackle rising interest rates
28/10/2021.description: Rates went ballistic this week but the Reserve Bank has a secret weapon for tackling inflation. But who would have thought it would entail Dan Andrews paying Josh Frydenberg?
28/10/2021.author: Michael West

29/10/2021.headline: HAPPY 90TH BIRTHDAY KING RUPERT!
29/10/2021.description: Even though ol’ Rupert’s birthday was back in march, he’s hosting his 90th celebration in New York today so we...
29/10/2021.author: Michael West

01/11/2021.headline: APM promoters exit jobless profits in ASX float, turn to profiteering from disabled
01/11/2021.description: The impending $972m float of employment services provider APM is a classic case of foreign financiers dumping their stock into the laps of unwitting sharemarket investors. Callum Foote, Stephanie Tran and Michael West report on a bonanza for middle-people
01/11/2021.author: Callum Foote

01/11/2021.headline: Dodgicel: Andy Penn given more billions, this time to beat China to a telco takeover
01/11/2021.description: Why the blazes was Telstra slotted $1.6bn by the government to buy Digicell and annoy the Chinese, and how is it Telstra shares slumped by one-third during the bull market when they cooly took $100bn in public money? Kim Wingerei checks on the charmed existence of chief executive Andy Penn
01/11/2021.author: Kim Wingerei

02/11/2021.headline: Blessed are the Litigants: Catholic backlash over cemeteries grab
02/11/2021.description: A PR man for Catholic Church has threatened Michael West Media with legal action for coverage of the battle for control of Sydney's cemeteries. Callum Foote evaluates the claims of the Catholic Metropolitan Cemeteries Trust and its crisis consultants
02/11/2021.author: Callum Foote

03/11/2021.headline: From backstreets of Glasgow, our man in a car’s eye on COP26
03/11/2021.description: Sir Maxwell MacLeod isn't sitting around hurling bricks at the television as world leaders meeting at the climate summit in Glasgow fail to come up with a plan to save the planet. He is reporting the event onsite for MWM, his way.
03/11/2021.author: Sir Maxwell MacLeod

03/11/2021.headline: Regional Grants: a bumper crop of rorts
03/11/2021.description: The Morrison government’s country contingent knows how to count. If there’s a dollar to dole out to the regions, they will ensure that 80 cents of it goes to the people they won over or want to win over.
03/11/2021.author: Jommy Tee

04/11/2021.headline: A bumper crop of rorts
04/11/2021.description: The Story: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/regional-grants-rorts-bbrf/ Follow Jommy on twitter: https://twitter.com/jommy_tee Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
04/11/2021.author: Michael West

06/11/2021.headline: Social media: time to turn around the weapons
06/11/2021.description: For all the benefits wrought by the information revolution, social media has become a tool of dictators. Its profit-driven, surveillance-based business model favours those with deep pockets and deadly motives. In the first of two articles, cybersecurity expert and human rights activist Manal al-Sharif suggests way to invent the digital world for the better.
06/11/2021.author: Manal al-Sharif

07/11/2021.headline: Using water wisely, Barnaby? Or another dicey deal in the pipeline?
07/11/2021.description: Barnaby Joyce has dipped into a water infrastructure fund to grant $5 million to a company well-connected with Tasmania’s Liberal Party elite so they can build a 7km pipeline under Hobart’s Derwent River to water a newly planned, privately owned golf course, reports Callum Foote.
07/11/2021.author: Callum Foote

08/11/2021.headline: Chasing the gold, we trade away rights of the old
08/11/2021.description: Australia has signed on to one of the world's biggest ever trade deals with most of the Asia-Pacific. We negotiated a suite a exemptions to look after our social compact, but guess who was sacrificed?  Dr Sarah Russell reports.
08/11/2021.author: Dr Sarah Russell

09/11/2021.headline: Necropolis Now: crunch time for Catholic cemetery bid
09/11/2021.description: The decision of whether to hand control over Sydney’s most valuable cemeteries to the Catholic Church may be made tomorrow. Callum Foote reports.
09/11/2021.author: Callum Foote

09/11/2021.headline: Addicted to privatisation, addicted to failure
09/11/2021.description: The takeover bid for Sydney Airport all but done, a takeover frenzy grips the sharemarket. Investors, foreign and local, know Australian governments are an easy touch, that they allow their citizens to be pillaged, that some of them actually believe the bankers' myth that privatisation means efficiency. Michael West reports
09/11/2021.author: Michael West

10/11/2021.headline: We’re being threatened AGAIN!
10/11/2021.description: The Story: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/blessed-are-the-litigants-catholic-backlash-over-cemeteries-grab/ Necropolis Now: crunch time for Catholic cemetery bid Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
10/11/2021.author: Michael West

10/11/2021.headline: Coal baron the frontrunner as Coalition finally unfurls climate technology which exists
10/11/2021.description: Coal baron and Liberal donor Trevor St Baker is a ripe candidate for Scott Morrison's electric vehicles (EVs) subsidies. Callum Foote reports on the commendable materialisation of a Coalition climate action technology which actually exists.
10/11/2021.author: Callum Foote

11/11/2021.headline: Wood for the Trees: rush to green hydrogen masks mammoth plans to wood-chip the forests
11/11/2021.description: Is green hydrogen yet another spin with catastrophic consequences for the environment? Sue Arnold looks behind the greenwash to find wide-scale plans for logging for wood-chips
11/11/2021.author: Suzanne Arnold

13/11/2021.headline: Regional grants: the pork is succulent in super-safe seats
13/11/2021.description: The electorates of Coalition ministers Mark Coulton and David Littleproud have benefited  hugely from some juggling of the funding rul
13/11/2021.author: Jommy Tee

15/11/2021.headline: Unquiet graves: Muslims add to criticism over the great cemetery takeover
15/11/2021.description: Sydney's Muslims are considering a complaint to ICAC over Premier Dominic Perrottet's apparent favouritism towards the Catholic Church’s attempted takeover of NSW cemeteries, reports Callum Foote.
15/11/2021.author: Callum Foote

16/11/2021.headline: Gouging Government: how a billion-dollar job agency dudded taxpayers, then the super funds
16/11/2021.description: Sharemarket pirates have cashed in on Australia’s unemployed. They are targeting the disabled and the elderly next. Callum Foote and Michael West investigate the monumental fee gouge by freshly floated APM and other job agencies
16/11/2021.author: Michael West

16/11/2021.headline: It’s none of our business what happened to Morrison at Tourism Australia. Just ask ‘Scott’
16/11/2021.description: New evidence shows the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) interfered in denying a Freedom of Information (FOI) request by Michael West Media (MWM) into Scott Morrison’s sacking from Tourism Australia in 2006
16/11/2021.author: Jommy Tee

17/11/2021.headline: ‘Obnoxious fabrication’: Paul Keating blasts Herald and Age coverage of his China views
17/11/2021.description: Former prime minister Paul Keating's speech last week on Australia-China relations has generated wide debate. Last Saturday his views were critiqued by Peter Hartcher in The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age. His reply to that article was rejected by those newspapers. This is an edited version of the rejected article.
17/11/2021.author: Paul Keating

17/11/2021.headline: Glasgow kissoff: our man in a car is driven to tears
17/11/2021.description: With the hype removed and the political posturing ignored, was COP 26 a success?  And what were they all saying about Australia?
17/11/2021.author: Sir Maxwell MacLeod

17/11/2021.headline: He never lies or answers FOI’s
17/11/2021.description: The Story: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/its-none-of-our-business-what-happened-to-morrison-at-tourism-australia-just-ask-scott/ Where the bloody hell is it? Did Scott Morrison lie about the report that saved his bacon...
17/11/2021.author: Michael West

18/11/2021.headline: Defamation disaster: bid to muzzle journalists, teachers, no more than a lawyers’ fee-fest
18/11/2021.description: With a small army of lawyers having already gouged hundreds of thousands of dollars in fees, Canberra law firm Meyer Vandenberg continues to stand over independent media with defamation threats, writes Michael West.
18/11/2021.author: Michael West

19/11/2021.headline: Profits of punishment: the big business of Australia’s private prisons
19/11/2021.description: Multinational prison contractors reap billion-dollar government contracts with soaring profits throughout the pandemic while inmates and their loved ones languish through uncertainty, lockdowns and COVID-19 outbreaks. An investigation by Stephanie Tran into Australia's privatised prisons.
19/11/2021.author: Stephanie Tran

21/11/2021.headline: When governments defy the people: the authoritarian blueprint for oppression
21/11/2021.description: Inspired by the Arab Spring, Manal al-Sharif used social media to start and lead movements. In the second of two articles, the Saudi-born cybersecurity expert and human rights activist examines how her home country uses social media to crush dissent. She explains how digital rights and human rights are inextricably intertwined, and how the absence of the former is the death knell of the latter.
21/11/2021.author: Manal al-Sharif

23/11/2021.headline: Recovery, resilience and a riddle or three: Morrison’s disaster-fighting behemoth
23/11/2021.description: Scott Morrison's National Recovery and Resilience Agency was formed in May to oversee an eye-watering $8 billion in disaster relief funds. Is it doing the job was intended to do? Callum Foote investigates the Prime Minister’s secrecy-loving new agency
23/11/2021.author: Callum Foote

24/11/2021.headline: Revealed: Rupert Murdoch’s crack team of Liberal Party fundraisers
24/11/2021.description: News Corp columnists have continued to beat the bushes for the Coalition at fundraising events, the latest batch of political donations...
24/11/2021.author: Stephanie Tran

24/11/2021.headline: MWM PODCAST – David McBride
24/11/2021.description: Support David here: https://www.gofundme.com/f/50-years-in-jail-for-whistleblowing-on-the-adf?utm_source=customer&utm_medium=copy_link_all&utm_campaign=p_cp+share-sheet Follow David on twitter: https://twitter.com/MurdochCadell Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/ #AfghanFiles
24/11/2021.author: Michael West

26/11/2021.headline: Wasted JobKeeper could have funded JobSeeker raise for five years
26/11/2021.description: Australia's Jobseeker rate is second lowest in the OECD. The $40 billion wasted through JobKeeper could have funded a raise for over 5 years.
26/11/2021.author: Callum Foote

26/11/2021.headline: Amended dignity: our elders denied their human rights again
26/11/2021.description: It will be up to the Senate to hold the line against one of the Morrison government's most alarming sleights of hand regarding the welfare of Australia's elderly. Sarah Russell investigates.
26/11/2021.author: Dr Sarah Russell

29/11/2021.headline: Scott Morrison’s bureaucracy bloat: cost of government soars to $100 billion
29/11/2021.description: In spite of the Liberal party's small-government rhetoric, Prime Minister Scott Morrison is overseeing the most expensive government in recent memory with departmental expenses outstripping both tax revenue and Australia's GDP; and dwarfing Labor. Callum Foote investigates
29/11/2021.author: Callum Foote

30/11/2021.headline: Pfizer refuses to share vaccine knowledge as it announces $US36 billion in vaccine revenue
30/11/2021.description: While rich countries like Australia are reaching 80% or more double vaccination rates, less than 5% of people in many low income countries have received COVID-19 vaccines. Millions are dying while new more infectious strains of the virus develop
30/11/2021.author: Patricia Ranald

01/12/2021.headline: The hidden world of power and influence: donors pay top dollar for a seat at Ministers’ table
01/12/2021.description: “We don’t live in a democracy anymore. We live in a plutocracy. The Australian political system is a wholly owned subsidiary of big corporations.” An investigation reveals donors paying top dollar at political fundraising events for exclusive access to ministers
01/12/2021.author: Stephanie Tran

01/12/2021.headline: JoshKeeper: Patrick slams “piss weak” Senate body in Tax Commissioner contempt row over JobKeeper secrecy
01/12/2021.description: Australia's slide into corporatocracy continues apace. Executives of oil giant Exxon flat out lied about their tax havens to a senate inquiry and were not sanctioned. Not even a slap on the wrist. Now the senate's Privileges Committee has allowed the Tax Commissioner to thumb his nose at the Senate by by refusing to release JobKeeper data.
01/12/2021.author: Callum Foote

02/12/2021.headline: Suffering in comparison: Australia’s economic outcomes the worst in 60 years
02/12/2021.description: The Covid pandemic has affected several industries and data sets. But it does not explain Australia falling down the global tables on economic performance.
02/12/2021.author: Alan Austin

03/12/2021.headline: ‘Sustainable’ logging: when will we twig to the scams?
03/12/2021.description: Governments appear to be rushing into green hydrogen without comprehensive understanding, methodology and defined sources, writes Sue Arnold.
03/12/2021.author: Suzanne Arnold

04/12/2021.headline: Treasurer Measurer: exploding the Liberal election myth of superior economic managers
04/12/2021.description: Does the Liberal Party's claim to be "superior economic managers" stack up? No. We dig back to Harold Holt, through 60 years of Australia's Treasurers, to find the best and worst. A Callum Foote investigation.
04/12/2021.author: Callum Foote

06/12/2021.headline: Ranking Australia’s worst treasurers
06/12/2021.description: The Story: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/treasurer-measurer-exploding-the-liberal-election-myth-of-superior-economic-managers/ Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
06/12/2021.author: Michael West

07/12/2021.headline: Don’t be so reckless: Coalition government is anything but efficient
07/12/2021.description: With an election looming, the Coalition government will attempt to recultivate its image as the party for efficient government, and Labor as the party of bureaucratic red tape. Callum Foote investigates how the government has been run.
07/12/2021.author: Callum Foote

07/12/2021.headline: Jobactive report: who profited from it?
07/12/2021.description: Our financial analysis of the major earners from the publicly funded jobactive model suggests that it is primarily American-owned multinational...
07/12/2021.author: Callum Foote

09/12/2021.headline: Rampant rorts in the regions: how it happens
09/12/2021.description: A little administrative juggling, and an unlikely set of funding proposals magically turns into reality, writes Jommy Tee in his continuing series on regional grants.
09/12/2021.author: Jommy Tee

09/12/2021.headline: Back to first principles: a blueprint to revive Australian democracy
09/12/2021.description: Parliament is in recess and another year has gone without the Morrison government honouring its promise to establish a federal ICAC. It is clearly reluctant to do so at all, while rorts and scandals continue to erode trust in our politicians.
09/12/2021.author: Kim Wingerei

10/12/2021.headline: The usual suspects star in annual Tax Office data-dump paying donut on their billions
10/12/2021.description: The latest Tax Office transparency report shows the oil and gas juggernauts are, again, Australia’s biggest tax grifters. Callum Foote and Michael West report on the good and the bad in multinational tax-dodging land.
10/12/2021.author: Michael West

11/12/2021.headline: Gladys v Zali: right battle, wrong time
11/12/2021.description: The decision by Gladys Berejiklian to not contest the seat of Warringah deprives us of what would have been one of the marquee battles of the 2022 federal election. But there are many other independent v Liberal contests looming
11/12/2021.author: Mark Sawyer

14/12/2021.headline: How the Reserve Bank rescued Australia from Scott and Josh
14/12/2021.description: Extraordinary details have emerged of how the Reserve Bank intervened to stop Treasurer Josh Frydenberg crashing the economy as the pandemic took grip, how, contrary to their fable of "superior economic management", the Morrison Coalition pursued political gain over good government, and how they have been borrowing its billions almost for free.
14/12/2021.author: Michael West

14/12/2021.headline: Banquet of the Chooks: MYEFO budget leaks gobbled up in media feeding frenzy
14/12/2021.description: They sure were feeding the chooks last night. Rupert Murdoch’s The Australian went live with its “exclusive” story at midnight: “Covid-19, NDIS, in $50bn blow to mid-year budget”. Michael West takes a light look at the Morrison government's media and marketing tactics.
14/12/2021.author: Michael West

15/12/2021.headline: Josh lights economic fires, RBA left to put them out
15/12/2021.description: THE STORY: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/how-the-reserve-bank-rescued-australia-from-scott-and-josh/ Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
15/12/2021.author: Michael West

15/12/2021.headline: Are we being served? Restaurateurs swamped by labour rout in wake of bruising lockdowns
15/12/2021.description: The world of work has changed dramatically in the past two years of pandemic. Emergency measures have sent businesses to the wall and left others unable to fill staff gaps. We have learnt overdue lessons on the value of the people who conduct the many backbreaking and thankless tasks in hospitality and tourism. But control of the commanding heights of the labour market remains with the big end of town,  writes Michael Sainsbury.
15/12/2021.author: Michael Sainsbury

17/12/2021.headline: Eight years in, how do our Coalition economic management gurus measure up?
17/12/2021.description: Elected on a promise to eliminate Labor's ''debt disaster'', the Coalition has added $600 billlion to the national ledger.
17/12/2021.author: Alan Austin

18/12/2021.headline: The last shall be first: our most righteous funding program revealed
18/12/2021.description: Regional and rural individuals and organisations believed that their application for a grant would judged on merit. They were sadly mistaken.
18/12/2021.author: Jommy Tee

19/12/2021.headline: Twilight of the coal boom as banks run out of excuses to fund coking coal
19/12/2021.description: Coking coal is headed the way of thermal coal, despite the present frenzy in exports and coal company profits. Diplomatic tension between China and Australia, pressure to act on climate, and the rise in scrap steel recycling, mean banks are running out of excuses to finance "methane super-emitters"
19/12/2021.author: Simon Nicholas

19/12/2021.headline: Australia robbed again!
19/12/2021.description: The latest Tax Office transparency report shows the oil and gas juggernauts are, again, Australia’s biggest tax grifters. Callum Foote...
19/12/2021.author: Michael West

22/12/2021.headline: Smugglers’ nest: the Godot-awful wait for Australia to close money-laundering loopholes
22/12/2021.description: The flood of black money into Australia proceeds apace, pushing up property prices, as the government dithers on its international pledge to enact money-laundering laws.
22/12/2021.author: Callum Foote

23/12/2021.headline: Who didn’t replace the toner? How our ex-prime ministers spent a million bucks
23/12/2021.description: Malcolm Turnbull may have memorably coined the term miserable ghost for Rudd and Abbott, but he and his superannuated colleagues in the Ex-Prime Ministers Club are no misers.
23/12/2021.author: Stephanie Tran

24/12/2021.headline: Launder your money through Australian real estate!
24/12/2021.description: The flood of black money into Australia proceeds apace, pushing up property prices, as the government dithers on its international...
24/12/2021.author: Michael West

24/12/2021.headline: Room at the Inn: yet Australia’s asylum seekers face another Christmas in lockdown
24/12/2021.description: Even those fleeing the Taliban, asylum seekers who helped our war effort in Afghanistan, face indefinite detention for another year. Lawyer and human rights advocate Alison Battisson reports on the victims of Australia's detention regime and their fight for freedom.
24/12/2021.author: Alison Battison

25/12/2021.headline: Future shock: the electorates of Abbott, and Howard, and Rudd, and Turnbull …
25/12/2021.description: There is no doubt that that Tony Abbott, as a former prime minister, will have a federal electorate named after him after he dies. If he didn't, a century-old tradition would be overturned.
25/12/2021.author: Mark Sawyer

28/12/2021.headline: Media diversity in Australia
28/12/2021.description: MWM PODCAST EP3 – Daniel Pearce takes a look into the Media diversity in Australia senate inquiry and dives into...
28/12/2021.author: Michael West

28/12/2021.headline: Australia standing proud — and increasingly alone — as property haven for international criminals
28/12/2021.description: Canberra has made it clear that Australian gatekeeper professions are open for business. Any kind of business. But things are changing fast. In a radical policy shift under the Biden Administration, Australia could soon find itself alone as the only developed nation which remains a renegade on global money laundering.
28/12/2021.author: Nathan Lynch

29/12/2021.headline: IKEA it ain’t: don’t go looking for friendly nuclear option, no matter the spin
29/12/2021.description: Despite the Murdoch media hype over small nuclear reactors as a solution for Australia's "clean energy" future, this is costly technology which barely exists in a commercial sense. Noel Wauchope explores the murky world of funding for Small Nuclear Reactors (SMRs).
29/12/2021.author: Noel Wauchope

30/12/2021.headline: Rupert Murdoch media inquiry misses the real bogeys
30/12/2021.description: Half a million Australians have called for a Royal Commission into Rupert Murdoch and Australia's media concentration. Are News Corp thuggery and media diversity the main game though? Michael West investigates a mollycoddled media.
30/12/2021.author: Michael West

30/12/2021.headline: The Canberra Bubble
30/12/2021.description: Regardless of the press galleries’ decision we will be sending our reporter Callum Foote and a videographer to Canberra to...
30/12/2021.author: Michael West

02/01/2022.headline: Whopper Returns: Tax Office fee bonanza the latest in the privatisation of government
02/01/2022.description: Around the world, governments deliver free Covid testing. So the news did not go down well that Harvey Norman and Chemist Warehouse, allies of the Coalition (and in Harvey Norman's case, grand JobKeeper spongers too), were looking to turn a profit by selling Rapid Antigen Tests
02/01/2022.author: Callum Foote

05/01/2022.headline: They ‘let her rip’, and she ripped; government collapses in Australia
05/01/2022.description: It’s a dang good thing we’re winning the cricket because the government has collapsed. Scott Morrison's Team Australia has left the health system to fail; the virus is out of control, tracking and testing has crashed, and Liberal Party corporate mates Harvey Norman and Chemist Warehouse are profiteering. Michael West looks at the price of Scomo's "personal responsibility".
05/01/2022.author: Michael West

05/01/2022.headline: Skilled migrant arrivals hit 20-year low – but Covid is not the reason for innovation deflation
05/01/2022.description: The drop in skilled workers arriving in Australia has hit the economy, and it began many years before the Pandemic. Alan Austin reports on the decline of innovation.
05/01/2022.author: Alan Austin

05/01/2022.headline: Australia smells a rat
05/01/2022.description: "They let it rip. And it ripped. Three Covid infections in Bali yesterday, 35,000 in NSW. Nursing homes are locking...
05/01/2022.author: Michael West

08/01/2022.headline: Visa Gridlock: the migration surge is coming … but who is it?
08/01/2022.description: The Morrison government, Immigration Minister Alex Hawke and the business lobby desperately want a surge in immigration to fire the economy but 330,000 migrants remain stuck on bridging visas as the permanent migration program remains mired at an intake of 160,000.
08/01/2022.author: Abul Rizvi

10/01/2022.headline: TANKS A LOT SCOTT!
10/01/2022.description: No free RAT tests but Dutton has forked out $3.5 billion for tanks to replace a fleet we purchased in...
10/01/2022.author: Michael West

10/01/2022.headline: Big business profiteers ride Omicron wave, private hospital profit wave is next
10/01/2022.description: Big business profiteers have made out like bandits through the Pandemic, emboldened by myriad failures of government and community panic. Callum Foote and Stephanie Tran report on the RAT test wave and the wave of private hospital profit opportunity looming in its wake.
10/01/2022.author: Callum Foote

11/01/2022.headline: “Living with Covid” – not so easy if you’re in an aged care home!
11/01/2022.description: Covid has spread like wildfire to around 500 aged care homes as the government failed to deliver RATs, booster vaccines and a surge workforce
11/01/2022.author: Dr Sarah Russell

12/01/2022.headline: “Biggest cyber breach in history” as techs scramble to be heard above Omicron din
12/01/2022.description: Australian governments and businesses have been warned they face their greatest hacking threat yet, Apache Log4j. John Stapleton reports on Australian Cyber Security Centre warnings of possible widespread systems failure
12/01/2022.author: John Stapleton

14/01/2022.headline: Yes, “rules are rules” Scott, you invent them, break them, subvert them and ignore them
14/01/2022.description: PM Scott Morrison came out strongly against Novak Djokovic again this week, claiming "rules are rules" but his government are prolific rule breakers
14/01/2022.author: Michael West

16/01/2022.headline: Government sabotages rule of law in Djokovic case for political advantage
16/01/2022.description: The Morrison government's campaign to toss tennis star Novak Djokovic out of Australia is an attack on the rule of law and the independence of the judiciary.
16/01/2022.author: Callum Foote

17/01/2022.headline: Housing affordability plunge: radical policy the only answer
17/01/2022.description: Home ownership has plunged from 43% of Australians to just 30% in 20 years, while mortgages and renting has jumped.
17/01/2022.author: Steve Keen

18/01/2022.headline: State versus State, gas mate versus gas mate, a fossil fuels bonanza with a planet on the line
18/01/2022.description: Emissions targets are dead. Corrupt governments in hock to their corporate donors are accelerating fossil fuel projects despite international condemnation, economic logic and the future of the planet. Michael West reports on Kurri Kurri gas plant and the slew of new projects.
18/01/2022.author: Michael West

18/01/2022.headline: State versus state, gas mate versus gas mate, a fossil fuels bonanza with a planet on the line
18/01/2022.description: Emissions targets are dead. Corrupt governments in hock to their corporate donors are accelerating fossil fuel projects despite international condemnation, economic logic and the future of the planet. Michael West reports on Kurri Kurri gas plant and the slew of new projects.
18/01/2022.author: Michael West

19/01/2022.headline: Screen Australia awards grant to former Harvey Weinstein associate for Gender Matters’ initiative
19/01/2022.description: Screen Australia has awarded over $2 million in funding to a company owned by a former associate of Harvey Weinstein.
19/01/2022.author: Callum Foote

21/01/2022.headline: Slip, sliding away: is Western Australia doing a bit of conscious uncoupling from the rest of Oz?
21/01/2022.description: Is a third of the Australian continent planning to stay cut off from the other two-thirds forever. Mark Sawyer ponders the future of the great state of Western Australia.
21/01/2022.author: Mark Sawyer
